column5: You guys, it's a hoax!  I live in Hamilton and see Lake Ontario everyday and can tell you it was never drained!
I see..... are you sure?
I saw the statue of liberty a 747 and an elephant disappear on T.V. and they claimed their was no funny business while doing it.....   Art
because the drain is plugged with stelco slag  now that it was on tv and the internet it is true....one always has to confirm the other
lol funny
Anyone else watching?
Was out on GBay on Tuesday.. down a good 6" since the time we were out before!
Yes I am . .
I'm taping it, don't tell me what happens
Very interesting show
What channel is it on?
Uhmmmmmm the Discovery Channel?
Maybe it's on Discovery eh?
LOL
Wups..  Missed that part..  Vodka on a sunday night..  Gotta stop doing that
They filled them back up, don't sell the boat
WOOOOOOOOOOHOOOOOOOOOOOOO! I'll get my camera back!
it was a good show, I look forward to the rest
yes it wasd a great show !!! very interesting stuff,and it was a good history lesson,and to see what the bottoms of the lakes really look like....
We watched it last night , pretty awsome .
I saw my lure!
I watched last night and this morning (pvr). Will there be more in a series or just this show.
Anyone want to buy a boat,   no fish left. The sky is falling. I won't be here to see it. Interesting show though.
I watched it and enjoyed the show... but I did not see the Avro Arrow, sitting on the bottom of Lake O!  Saw a ton of Gobbies though! HH
Is it available if you missed it?  I'd be really interested.
It's on again on Thursday at 8pm.
lmao,me too! and a cell phone!
I found it interesting, but don't think they could fit all they wanted into the 1 hour show.  Lots of shipwrecks they could have shown and they should have spent more time on each lake IMO.
I'm sending my Humminbird 798si back to see if they can upgrade it to the imaging quality on the Hydrographic Survey boats!
They're using Lowrance units.
